t: Isaiah 66
Heaven Is God’s Throne
Thus*p says the Lord,*s “Heaven*pn is My throne and the earth is My footstool. Where*ln then is a house you could build for Me? And*ln where is a place that I may rest?

For*ln My hand made all these things, Thus*ln all these things came into being,” declares the Lord.*s “But*ln to this one I will look, To*ln him who is humble and contrite of spirit, and who trembles at My word.
Hypocrisy Rebuked

“But*ipn he who kills an ox is like*i one who slays a man; He*ln who sacrifices a lamb is like*i the one who breaks a dog’s neck; He*ln who offers a grain offering is*i like*i one*i who*i offers*i swine’s blood; He*ln who burns incense is like*i the one who blesses an idol. As*ln they have chosen their own*i ways, And*ln their soul delights in their abominations,

So*ln I will choose their punishments And*ln will bring on them what they dread. Because*ln I called, but no one answered; I*ln spoke, but they did not listen. And*ln they did evil in My sight And*ln chose that in which I did not delight.”

Hear*ln the word of the Lord,*s you who tremble at His word: “Your*ln brothers who hate you, who exclude you for My name’s sake, Have*ln said, ‘Let the Lord*s be glorified, that we may see your joy.’ But*ln they will be put to shame.
A*ln voice of uproar from the city, a voice from the temple, The*ln voice of the Lord*s who is rendering recompense to His enemies.
“Before*ln she travailed, she brought forth; Before*ln her pain came, she gave birth to a boy.
Who*ln has heard such a thing? Who has seen such things? Can*ln a land be born in one day? Can*ln a nation be brought forth all at once? As*ln soon as Zion travailed, she also brought forth her sons.
Shall*ln I bring to the point of birth and not give delivery?” says the Lord.*s “Or*ln shall I who gives delivery shut the*i womb?”*i says your God.
Joy in Jerusalem’s Future
“Be*pn joyful with Jerusalem and rejoice for her, all you who love her; Be*ln exceedingly glad with her, all you who mourn over her,
That*ln you may nurse and be satisfied with her comforting breasts, That*ln you may suck and be delighted with her bountiful bosom.”

For*ln thus says the Lord,*s “Behold, I extend peace to her like a river, And*ln the glory of the nations like an overflowing stream; And*ln you will be nursed, you will be carried on the hip and fondled on the knees.
As*ln one whom his mother comforts, so I will comfort you; And*ln you will be comforted in Jerusalem.”

Then*ln you will see this,*i and your heart will be glad, And*ln your bones will flourish like the new grass; And*ln the hand of the Lord*s will be made known to His servants, But*ln He will be indignant toward His enemies.
For*ln behold, the Lord*s will come in fire And*ln His chariots like the whirlwind, To*ln render His anger with fury, And*ln His rebuke with flames of fire.
For*ln the Lord*s will execute judgment by fire And*ln by His sword on all flesh, And*ln those slain by the Lord*s will be many.

“Those*ln who sanctify and purify themselves to*i go*i to the gardens, Following*ln one in the center, Who*ln eat swine’s flesh, detestable things and mice, Will*ln come to an end altogether,” declares the Lord.*s
“For*p I know their works and their thoughts; the time is coming to gather all nations and tongues. And they shall come and see My glory.

I will set a sign among them and will send survivors from them to the nations: Tarshish, Put, Lud, Meshech, Tubal and Javan, to the distant coastlands that have neither heard My fame nor seen My glory. And they will declare My glory among the nations.

Then they shall bring all your brethren from all the nations as a grain offering to the Lord,*s on horses, in chariots, in litters, on mules and on camels, to My holy mountain Jerusalem,” says the Lord,*s “just as the sons of Israel bring their grain offering in a clean vessel to the house of the Lord.*s
I will also take some of them for priests and*i for Levites,” says the Lord.*s
“For*pn just as the new heavens and the new earth Which*ln I make will endure before Me,” declares the Lord,*s “So*ln your offspring and your name will endure.
And*ln it shall be from new moon to new moon And*ln from sabbath to sabbath, All*ln mankind will come to bow down before Me,” says the Lord.*s

“Then*ln they will go forth and look On*ln the corpses of the men Who*ln have transgressed against Me. For*ln their worm will not die And*ln their fire will not be quenched; And*ln they will be an abhorrence to all mankind.”
